type_word.description: Verbs used with another verb to form tenses, voices, or moods, such as 'have', 'be', 'do'.

type_word.name: Past Tense
type_word.description: A tense expressing an action that has happened or a state that previously existed.

definition: Past tense of 'be'.
examples: I was late for work today.
She was a talented singer in her youth.
He was in the kitchen when the accident happened.
We were so young when we first met.
It was a beautiful day.

es.definition: Indica que algo pertenece a él.

pt.definition: Indica que algo pertence a ele.

type_word.name: Pronoun
type_word.description: Words used in place of a noun.

definition: Used to indicate that something belongs to or is connected with him.
examples: His name is John.
That's his car over there.
He forgot his wallet at home.
This is his first trip to Europe.
His ideas were not taken into account.

es.definition: Relativo a los ciudadanos o a la ciudadanía

pt.definition: Relativo aos cidadãos ou à cidadania

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns, as distinct from military or ecclesiastical matters.
examples: Civil aviation is the operation of aircraft by civilians for private or commercial purposes.
In a civil society, discourse and differing opinions are encouraged for the sake of progress.
Civil law sets regulations for disputes between individuals or organizations.
His civil behavior was appreciated in a formal setting.
They taught him the importance of civil duties like voting and paying taxes.

es.definition: Vencer a alguien, especialmente en una competencia, juego o conflicto.

pt.definition: Superar alguém, especialmente em uma competição, jogo ou conflito.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Transitive Verb
type_word.description: A verb that requires a direct object.

definition: To win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game, etc.
examples: She was defeated in the last election.
This team has never suffered defeat.
I admit defeat, you are a better player than me.
This strategy could defeat our purpose.
We must study these plans to find the best way to defeat them.

es.definition: Estudio y relato de los hechos y sucesos de tiempos pasados, especialmente de aquellos que afectan al curso de la civilización humana.

pt.definition: Estudo e narrativa dos fatos e eventos dos tempos passados, especialmente daqueles que afetam o curso da civilização humana.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The study of past events, particularly in human affairs.
examples: He teaches history at the university.
History will be the judge of these decisions.
It's a historical movement without compare in the history of our country.
Studying history helps us understand and appreciate our origins and our past.
History tends to repeat itself, so we should learn from it.

es.definition: Además; en adición.

pt.definition: Além disso; em adição.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In addition; as well.
examples: I'd like a beer, and also a glass of water.
He's studying chemistry, and also biology.
She works a full-time job, but also goes to school in the evenings.
I'm a fan of classical literature, but also enjoy modern novels.
They want to hire someone who is skilled in programming, but also understands design.

es.definition: Utilizado para indicar un estado, situación o modo.

pt.definition: Usado para indicar um estado, situação ou modo.

type_word.name: Preposition
type_word.description: Words used before a noun or pronoun to form a phrase modifying another word in the sentence.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

type_word.name: Particle
type_word.description: A word that joins with a verb to create a phrasal verb, like 'up' in 'pick up'.

type_word.name: Phrase
type_word.description: A small group of words standing together as a conceptual unit.

type_word.name: Phrasal Verb
type_word.description: A verb combined with a preposition or an adverb (or both), where the combination creates a meaning different from the original verb, such as 'turn off' or 'run into'.

definition: Used to indicate a state, situation, or mode.
examples: The light is on.
He left his glasses on the table.
Keep on trying.
She goes on holiday on Tuesday.
The meeting is on the first of next month.

es.definition: Hacer o volverse diferente.

pt.definition: Fazer ou tornar-se diferente.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: To make or become different.
examples: She decided to change her hairstyle.
We need to change the way we consume energy.
That experience completely changed my perspective.
Can you change a hundred dollar bill?
He changed his mind at the last moment.

es.definition: Que no puede ser satisfecho o que siempre quiere más de algo.

pt.definition: Que não pode ser satisfeito ou que sempre quer mais de algo.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Always wanting more, not able to be satisfied.
examples: Her insatiable curiosity led her to ask more questions.
His insatiable appetite for power led him down a dark path.
She has an insatiable desire to learn new languages.
He has an insatiable thirst for knowledge.
Her insatiable craving for chocolate makes dieting difficult.

es.definition: Duración de las cosas sujetas a cambio o de los seres que tienen una existencia finita.

pt.definition: Duração das coisas sujeitas à transformação ou dos seres que têm uma existência finita.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future regarded as a whole.
examples: The time is right for a change of strategy.
Only time will tell if we made the right decision.
I love the tranquillity that comes with nighttime.
Time heals all wounds, or so it is said.
This time, we will not fail.

es.definition: En este momento, todavía, o además

pt.definition: Neste momento, ainda, ou além disso

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: At this time, as yet, or in addition
examples: I love you still.
He is still a student.
There is still time to finish the project.
He is still living with his parents.
Do you still want to go out?
